708727f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708727f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, at 4lst Street.
The sign board on the esplanade announcing the
Gutenberg Exhibition. This photo taken the morning
after a snowstorm.
February 16, 1940
Nathan Schwartr
New York Public Lgbrary
Photostat Division

708744f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708744f-a.text:
The ''Spanish Apartents.'
At right corner is the Croton Reservoir
(5th Ave. from 42nd St. looking south)-  1880
This structure was at one time the home of the Rutgers
Female College.
Photo by Brown Brothers
220 West 42nd St.
New York City

708716f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708716f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., west side, north from 41st to 42nd (right) Streets,
showing the north wing of the Central Building of the New York Public
Library as photographed at dusk (6:30 P.M.). Skyscrapers on the north
side of West 42nd Street are in their order, the No. 500 Fifth Ave.
Building; the Salmon Towers and the Aeolian Building.
March 17, 1938.
Mr. Nathan Schwartz.
New York Public Library.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

708670f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708670f.text:
Fifth Avenue north from 4lst Street, showing pupils of the Spence
School for Girls out for their daily walk.
At the extreme left is the reservoir which for many years covered
the site now occupiew by the New York Public Library.
In the left background is the Bristol office building, formerly the
Hotel Bristol.
This was demolished in 192V to make way for the Salmon Tower.
The spires of St. Patrick's Cathecral may be dimly seen in the righ
background.
Temple Emanu-El, demolished in 1927 is the spired building in the
centre.
1900.
Ewing Galloway, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONST

708671f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708671f.text:
471 to 475 Fifth avenue, at S.E. corner of 41st Street, residence
and business buildings s ortly before their demolition.
The site is now occupied by the National City--Farmers' Trust
Bank Building.
April, 1925.
Photograph by Brown Brothers.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

708789f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708789f-a.text:
(1)
Fifth Avenue, east side, from 41st to 42nd Streets, from steps of the
New York Public Library. In the foreground may be seen part of a
picket line which was conducted for some weeks against the Fifth
Avenue Omnibus Company in connection with the discharge of twenty-
seven employees. The outcome of the dispute is unknown.
July 6, 1935.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view at 42nd Street.
July 2, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708729f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708729f-a.text:
Street Scenes: Political harangue on the New York Public Library
steps in the Roosevelt-Wilkie presidential contest. This speaker
is pro-Roosevelt; the Wilkie orator is to the left and not shown.
In the right background is the base of the office structure, No.
500 Fifth Avenue.
Fall 1940
Nathan Schwartz, phoko
N.Y.P.L. Photostat div.
MAY BE REPRODUCED

731212f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - U. S. Grant's Funeral.
731212f-a.text:
Celebrations, Parades and Municipal Events: The
General U. S. Grant funeral procession moving northward
on Fifth Avenue as photographed from 41st Street atop the
old reservoir. The dominant structure with flag atop is
the Union League Club at the N. E. corner of 39th Street.
August 8, 1885
H. N. Tiemann, Photo
00ift of Urbrock Collection
CREDIT LINE INPERATIVE

708708f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708708f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., west side, at 41st Street (main entrance to the
N. Y. P. L).
A photo showing ''Beauty' seated on ''Pegasus'' and mounted in the
south niche. This is by Frederick Macmonnies. For further data, see
The History of the New York Public Library by H.M. Lydenberg (page
509).
July 14, 1936.
ift of G.D. Chinn.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

708730f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708730f.text:
Street Scenes: Political harangue on the New York Public Library
Steps in the Roosevelt-Wilkie presidential contest. This speaker
is pro-Roosevelt; the Wilkie orator is to the left and not shown.
Incidentally, the latter meking use of a mlcraphone drew larger
crowds. Credit for the adaptioniof this technic should be given
to the U. S. Senatorial candidate, Bruce Barton, an advertising
erecutive.
Fall 1940
Nathan Schwartz, photo
N.Y.P.L. Photostat div.
NAy BE REPRODUCED

708746f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 41st Street
708746f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., east side, south from East 42nd to 4lst Streets. Build-
ing shown, is Rutgers Female College (founded 1838 by Chancellor Ferris).
This photograph was presented to the graduating olass of 1875. This in-
stitution lost this property, at a later date, and moved to 56 Wost 55th
Street.
1875.
Gift of Mrs. C.M. Benson.
MAY BE REPPODUCED.
